title.narrative: Eritrea: Targeted country assistance
Érythrée (l'): Aide ciblée aux pays

description.narrative:
Plans d’assistance technique ciblée aux pays L’assistance technique ciblée aux pays (TCA) est octroyée sous forme de ressources destinées aux partenaires présents dans les pays. La TCA est un élément du cadre d’engagement avec les partenaires (PEF) de Gavi. Le plan de TCA d’un pays est établie selon les besoins exprimés du dit pays lors de l’évaluation conjointe. Un plan comprend une liste d’activités, d’étapes clés, et un budget pour une année dite. L’assistance technique est un soutien non financier fourni par des spécialistes. Elle peut revêtir plusieurs formes : partage d’information et de savoir-faire, formation et services-conseils.
L’assistance technique fournie dans le cadre du PEF est appelée aide ciblée aux pays. Ce type de soutien vise principalement à payer le personnel basé en permanence dans les bureaux pays des partenaires. Il repose sur la demande et les besoins identifiés par les pays eux-mêmes.

Targeted country assistance (TCA) are resources provided to in-country partners under Gavi’s partners’ engagement framework (PEF). A country’s TCA plan is based on needs expressed by the country during the joint appraisal discussions. It includes sets of activities, milestones and budget for a given year.Technical assistance is non-financial support provided by specialists. It can take the form of sharing information and expertise, training and consulting services.
The technical assistance provided through PEF is called targeted country assistance (TCA). This type of support mainly consists of staff permanently based in partners’ country offices. It is based on the demand and needs identified by the countries themselves.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Demand Promotion & ACSM
Communities in 2700 villages in Anseba, Gash-Barka, NRS, SRS , Debub and Maekel hold one dialogue on EPI activity.

target.value: Conduct community dialogue in 750 Kebabi Adminstration using one-to-ten youth/women approach and a of gender responsive, disablity friendly comminucation tools to the nine ethno-languages and cultures

comment.narrative: 40,311 facility and community-based health education was conducted nationwide reaching all 67 sub-zobas around the country; IEC materials and development of the EPI Demand Promotion Strategy 2022-26.

title.narrative: HCD tools will be developed and communication strategy and routine immunization calendar will be printed and distributed.

target.value: Advocacy, communication and social mobilization strategy for the introduction and integration of HPV and Hep-B vaccination into the routine EPI Sub-activities: 1. HCD survey (HCD is a participatory tools used to design effective communication strategy) 2. Printing RI calendar 3. Printing communication strategy

comment.narrative: COVID-19 travel restrictions and limited cross-zoba mobility created minor delays. RI calendar has been designed with inputs from EPI team.

title.narrative: Prepare art work, printing and distribution of EPI modular traing manual

target.value: updating and printing the EPI module by incorporating all new vaccine Sub-activity Technical working group neeting to update and finalize EPI traing module Printing of 1000 EPI Modular training manual.

comment.narrative: EPI training module for SBCC designed, pretested and finalized 1500 copies under print.

target.value: Design, test and distribute the Android based Apps for the dissemination of immunization information and defaulter tracing to health workers & communities and build capacity of the EPI staff on the installation and use of the Android Application

comment.narrative: Not done

title.narrative: UNICEF : Programme Management - LMC
HPV introduction experiences, lesson learnt will be shared by the EPI teams of Tanzania

target.value: Organize knowledge and experience gathering trip for the 6 EPI officials including UNICEF (2) to Tanzania on HPV introduction best practices, lesson learnt and success stories

comment.narrative: As HPV introduction will be conducted in April 2022, therefore the activity has been re-programmed and got approval from Gavi SCM. The new activity will be as below- "Conduct ToT for 20 HMIS staffs on customization and management, data analytics, trackers and score card to update routine immunization information system in Dhis2". This activity will follow once national HMIS colleagues will be trained by HISP Tanzania. It has planned by October 2021. (Repeated)

title.narrative: Target: 4 Districts Aretay,Karura?..

target.value: Conduct joint routine EPI monitoring and supportive supervision in the 16 districts where administrative data shows Penta-3 coverage lower than 79%; Sub- Activities: - Conduct assesement to - Identify bottlenecks and find solutions - Discuss with key EPI staffs on improvement - On-the job training on data analysis, identify gaps, and strengthen immunization services

comment.narrative: EVM 2.0 training has recently been completed and EVM 2.0 field assessment has also been conducted from November 01 to 07 ,2021. Data entry and analysis are in progress. EPI Manager has communicated to Gavi senior Country Manager and got reprogramming approval for EVMA 2.0 activities. This activity is completed.

target.value: Conduct training of 40 MoH EPI staff on Effective Vaccine Management Standard Operating Procedure at national level

comment.narrative: EVM will be conducted by October 2021 and CCI will be integrated with EVM 2,0 and logistical support will be provided to conduct CCI. Approval has already obtained from Gavi SCM

title.narrative: PATH : Vaccine-Specific Support
Revised HPV application submitted to Gavi, as needed

comment.narrative: Comments from Gavi pre-reviews and IRC reviews were discussed with the country and partners and TA for the response submission by the country completed.

title.narrative: Support to and attendance at NITAG, ICC, and related meetings is completed

comment.narrative: Eritrea supported for evidence generation on vaccine type to be introduced and strategies to be used to deliver the vaccine.

title.narrative: HPV application submitted to Gavi

target.value: ? Technical support for outline and development of HPV application ? Contribute to technical content of HPV application, including data compilation and lessons learned from other countries ? Contribute to the review and approval processes for HPV application with MOH and immunization stakeholders

comment.narrative: Requirements from Gavi were clearly communicated with the necessary guidelines for the development of the HPV application. Initial draft of the implementation plan was developed and shared with the country. Lessons learned from other countries on HPV introduction documented in order to supplement the application. This has resulted in the submission to Gavi on Jan 19, 2021.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Supply Chain & Procurement
40 Cold chain equipment routine and preventive maintenance will be conducted and report will be shared with the EPI manager.

target.value: Support the routine and preventive maintenance of the Cold Chain Equipment procured through JICA and CCEOP.

comment.narrative: Five TCW 15 and 2 Tcw 40 CCE have been repaired by the B-medical local sub-contractor and the MOH technicians. Besides, three TCW 2043 SDD installed to replace the manual generator of the zonal vaccine store in Keren, Anseba. There is a disagreement between the B-medical and their local subcontractor (New Eritrea builders over the amount of payments per service. The UNICEF Co. is discussing with the SD to resolve this disagreement.

target.value: Support the routine and preventive maintenance of the Cold Chain Equipment procured through JICA and CCEOP.

There is a disagreement between the B-medical and their local subcontractor (New Eritrea builders over the amount of payments per service. The UNICEF Co. is discussing with the SD to resolve this disagreement.

target.value: Support the routine and preventive maintenance of the Cold Chain Equipment procured through JICA and CCEOP.

comment.narrative: The technicians carried out the maintenance and repairs activities during the cold chain inventory which was carried out nation-wide in September 2021. Since the technicians visited all the health facilities , they used this opportunity to carry out maintenance and repairs of the cold chains.

title.narrative: Technical assistance to MOH is provided on cold chain,logistics and EVM training

target.value: Provide Technical Assistance on cold chain ,logistics and Effective Vaccine management including training and preventive and routine maintenance of the CCE

comment.narrative: Remote training on EVM 2.0 has been provided to MoH EPI , UNICEF and WHO EPI focal persons from March 15 to 19 2021. The actual EVM and CCI will be completed by end of October 2021.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Service Delivery
Two round integrated mobile clinic services will be performed

target.value: Support the integrated routine EPI mobile out reach services in hard to reach and less accessible 16 districts in the 4 regions to ensure immunization equity (2 rounds of mobile integrated EPI amd maternal health services).

comment.narrative: The MoH EPI conducted 4 rounds integrated EPI mobile out reach sessions in the HTR (inaccessible areas) in 6 districts of 3 zobas and 26,004 children less than 2 years old received vaccination shots of 11 vaccine preventable diseases while 2,586 women both pregnant and non-pregnant received Td vaccination as per WHO 5 doses schedule.

target.value: Support the integrated routine EPI mobile out reach services in hard to reach and less accessible 16 districts in the 4 regions to ensure immunization equity (2 rounds of mobile integrated EPI amd maternal health services).

title.narrative: UNICEF : Vaccine-Specific Support
HPV will be introducted and technical report will be shared

target.value:
Technical support to organize an in-country demo workshop in the preparation, and implementation of the HPV (Human Papiloma Vaccine) integration in the RI in 2020
Sub-Activities:
- ToT for the PHC and EPI Focal Persons - Develop implementation plan - Review and update RI guideline -Develop vaccaine and logistics plan - initiate procurement process

comment.narrative: As HPV introduction will be conducted in April 2022, therefore the activity has been re-programmed and got approval from Gavi SCM. The new activity will be as below- "Conduct ToT for 20 HMIS staffs on customization and management, data analytics, trackers and score card to update routine immunization information system in Dhis2". This activity will follow once national HMIS colleagues will be trained by HISP Tanzania. It has planned by October 2021
